conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D, E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A (cyan) starts from the top left.
A flows downward and is directed to the right by the cyan-colored baffle.
A continues to the right, bypassing other baffles until it reaches the bottom.
B (green) starts from the middle top.
B flows downward directly into the green baffle.
The green baffle redirects B to the right.
B follows the green baffle and flows into container F.
C (pink) starts from the top right.
C flows downward and is directed to the left by the pink-colored baffle.
C continues to the left, bypassing other baffles until it reaches the bottom.
Summary: A flows into container D, B flows into container F, and C flows into container E.
